author: Special Correspondent
text:
Four persons, including a woman and her two-year-old son, died on the spot when the jeep in which they were travelling collided head-on with a TNSTC bus near here on Saturday.

Police said Murugesan (40) of Semmadaipatti near here planned to go to Rameswaram with his family and relatives. He hired a jeep in which nine persons were travelling. They had left home at 12.30 p.m. and within 30 minutes, the jeep collided with the bus proceeding from Madurai to Coimbatore.

Murugesan’s wife Nadia (30), her son Akilan (2), Karupathal (55) and Vijayalakshmi (40) died on the spot. Murugesan and four others, including jeep driver Soundar and bus driver Sridhar, suffered multiple injuries and were referred to the Madurai Government Rajaji Hospital.
title: Four persons killed as jeep, bus collide
